summary: This is a November 16, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter transmits additional discovery materials, including Jencks Act and Giglio material for potential trial witnesses, and other materials related to individuals not currently intended to be called as witnesses. It details the protective order governing the materials.

events.title: Government Production of Discovery Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces additional Jencks Act, Giglio, and other witness-related materials to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Maxwell case governing the confidentiality and dissemination of discovery materials.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The government produced Jencks Act and Giglio material for potential trial witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The government also produced materials related to individuals it did not currently intend to call as witnesses, which included certain witness statements.
All produced materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and are marked as confidential under specific paragraphs of that order.
The letter clarifies the production is a courtesy and does not concede a legal obligation to provide all such materials.
The government reserved the right to call individuals listed in the index as witnesses at a later date.
